pre_eval_cfg = yaml.safe_load(
"""
globals:
  seed: 28
  val_fold: null  # indicate when training
  output_path: null # indicate when training
  device: cuda
  enable_amp: False
  max_epoch: 100
  cudnn_benchmark: False
  no_last_aug: False
  no_aug_epoch: 3
  label_smooth: False
  mixup_or_label: False
  mixup_lamda_05: False

model:
  type: RezeroTransformer
  num_features: 36
  num_hidden: 128
  dim_feedforward: 2048
  num_layers: 6
  num_heads: 8
  activation: gelu
  drop_rate: 0.5

dataset:
  mixup: {enabled: False, alpha: 1.0}
  train:
    type: PokemonDataset
    paths: null  # set by lazy_init
    labels: null  # set by lazy_init
    transform: null
  val:
    type: PokemonDataset
    paths: null  # set by lazy_init
    labels: null  # set by lazy_init
    transform: null
  test:
    type: PokemonDataset
    paths: null  # set by lazy_init
    labels: null  # set by lazy_init
    transform: "@/dataset/val/transform"
  no_aug_train:
    type: PokemonDataset
    paths: null  # set by lazy_init
    labels: null  # set by lazy_init
    transform: "@/dataset/val/transform"

loader:
  train: {type: DataLoader, dataset: "@/dataset/train",
    batch_size: 64, num_workers: 2, shuffle: True, pin_memory: True, drop_last: True}
  val: {type: DataLoader, dataset: "@/dataset/val",
    batch_size: 128, num_workers: 2, shuffle: False, pin_memory: True, drop_last: False}
  test: {type: DataLoader, dataset: "@/dataset/test",
    batch_size: 128, num_workers: 2, shuffle: False, pin_memory: True, drop_last: False}
  no_aug_train: {type: DataLoader, dataset: "@/dataset/no_aug_train",
    batch_size: 64, num_workers: 2, shuffle: True, pin_memory: True, drop_last: True}

optimizer:
  type: AdamW
  params: {type: method_call, obj: "@/model", method: parameters}
#   lr: 1.0e-06
  lr: 1.0e-03
  weight_decay: 1.0e-02

scheduler:
  type: OneCycleLR
  optimizer: "@/optimizer"
  epochs: "@/globals/max_epoch"
  steps_per_epoch: {type: __len__, obj: "@/loader/train"}
  max_lr: 1.0e-3
  pct_start: 0.1
  anneal_strategy: cos
  div_factor: 1.0e+3
  final_div_factor: 1.0e+3
#   type: CosineAnnealingWarmRestarts
#   optimizer: "@/optimizer"
#   T_0: 10
#   T_mult: 1


loss: {type: BCEWithLogitsLoss}
# loss: {type: BCEFocalLoss, "alpha":1.0}

eval:
  - type: micro_average
    metric_func: {type: BCEWithLogitsLoss}
    report_name: loss
  - type: calc_across_all_batchs
    metric_func: {type: ROCAUC}
    report_name: metric

manager:
  type: ExtensionsManager
  models: "@/model"
  optimizers: "@/optimizer"
  max_epochs: "@/globals/max_epoch"
  iters_per_epoch: {type: __len__, obj: "@/loader/train"}
  out_dir: "@/globals/output_path"
  # stop_trgiger: {type: EarlyStoppingTrigger,
  #   monitor: val/metric, mode: max, patience: 5, verbose: True,
  #   check_trigger: [1, epoch], max_trigger: ["@/globals/max_epoch", epoch]}

extensions:
  # # log
  - {type: observe_lr, optimizer: "@/optimizer"}
  - {type: LogReport}
  - {type: PlotReport, y_keys: lr, x_key: epoch, filename: lr.png}
  - {type: PlotReport, y_keys: [train/loss, val/loss], x_key: epoch, filename: loss.png}
  - {type: PlotReport, y_keys: val/metric, x_key: epoch, filename: metric.png}
  - {type: PrintReport, entries: [
      epoch, iteration, lr, train/loss, val/loss, val/metric, elapsed_time]}
  - {type: ProgressBarNotebook, update_interval: 20}
  - {type: SendWandB, entries: [
      lr, train/loss, val/loss, val/metric, elapsed_time], "fold_id":None}

  # snapshot
#   - extension: {type: snapshot, target: "@/model", filename: "snapshot_by_metric_epoch_{.epoch}.pth"}
#     trigger: {type: MaxValueTrigger, key: "val/metric", trigger: [1, epoch]}
  - extension: {type: snapshot, target: "@/model", filename: "snapshot_by_metric.pth"}
    trigger: {type: MaxValueTrigger, key: "val/metric", trigger: [1, epoch]}
  # lr scheduler
  - {type: LRScheduler, scheduler: "@/scheduler", trigger: [1,  iteration]}
"""
)

source.deb7c7a0:
def set_random_seed(seed: int = 42, deterministic: bool = False):
    """Set seeds"""
    random.seed(seed)
    np.random.seed(seed)
    os.environ["PYTHONHASHSEED"] = str(seed)
    torch.manual_seed(seed)
    torch.cuda.manual_seed(seed)  # type: ignore
    torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = deterministic  # type: ignore
    
set_random_seed(RANDAM_SEED)

source.e974c0c0:
feat_cols = ['HP', 'Attack', 'Defense', 'Sp_Atk', 'Sp_Def', 'Speed', 'Total', 'Legendary',
            'Type_OH_Bug', 'Type_OH_Dark', 'Type_OH_Dragon', 'Type_OH_Electric', 'Type_OH_Fairy',
            'Type_OH_Fighting', 'Type_OH_Fire', 'Type_OH_Flying', 'Type_OH_Ghost','Type_OH_Grass',
            'Type_OH_Ground', 'Type_OH_Ice', 'Type_OH_Normal', 'Type_OH_Poison', 'Type_OH_Psychic',
            'Type_OH_Rock', 'Type_OH_Steel', 'Type_OH_Water',
            'Generation_OH_1', 'Generation_OH_2', 'Generation_OH_3', 'Generation_OH_4', 'Generation_OH_5', 'Generation_OH_6']

def get_feat(target, battle, is_first):
    target_team = df_team_id[df_team_id['team_id']==target]
    battle_team = df_team_id[df_team_id['team_id']==battle]

    feats = []
    for i in range(1,7):
        target_col = f'pokemon_id_{i}'
        target_poke = target_team[target_col].values[0]
        target_types = df_pokemon[['Type_1', 'Type_2']][df_pokemon['pokemon_id']==target_poke].dropna(axis=1).values[0]

        type_matchs = []
        for j in range(1,7):
            battle_col = f'pokemon_id_{j}'
            battle_poke = battle_team[battle_col].values[0]
            battle_types = df_pokemon[['Type_1', 'Type_2']][df_pokemon['pokemon_id']==battle_poke].dropna(axis=1).values[0]

            for t in target_types:
                tmp = []
                for b in battle_types:
                    tmp.append(df_typetable[b][df_typetable['atck']==t].values)
                type_matchs.append(np.prod(tmp))
        feats.append(np.concatenate([
                            df_pokemon_feat[feat_cols][df_pokemon['pokemon_id']==target_poke].values[0],
                           np.mean(type_matchs).reshape(-1),
                           np.min(type_matchs).reshape(-1),
                           np.max(type_matchs).reshape(-1),
                            np.reshape(int(is_first),-1)
                          ],axis=0))
    return np.array(feats)

source.d0da1156:
class SimpleTransformer(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self,
                 num_features: int = 36,
                 num_hidden: int = 128,
                 dim_feedforward: int = 2048,
                 num_layers: int = 6,
                 num_heads: int = 8,
                 activation: str = 'relu',
                 drop_rate: float = 0.1,
                 num_classes: int = 1):
        super(SimpleTransformer, self).__init__()

        self.seq_linear = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_features, num_hidden),
            nn.LayerNorm(num_hidden),
            nn.Dropout(drop_rate),
            nn.ReLU(),
        )
        encoder_layer = nn.TransformerEncoderLayer(d_model=num_hidden, nhead=num_heads, dim_feedforward=dim_feedforward, dropout=drop_rate, activation=activation)
        self.transformer_encoder = nn.TransformerEncoder(encoder_layer, num_layers)
        # self.linear = nn.Linear(num_features, num_classes)
        self.head = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_hidden*2, num_hidden),
            nn.LayerNorm(num_hidden),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(drop_rate),
            nn.Linear(num_hidden, num_classes),
        )

    def forward(self, x):
        # print(x.shape) # BATCH, NUM_POKEMON, NUM_FEATUERS
        # print(x.dtype)
        x = self.seq_linear(x)
        # print(x.shape) # BATCH, NUM_POKEMON, NUM_HIDDEN
        x = x.permute(1,0,2) # [NUM_POKEMON, BATCH, NUM_HIDDEN]
        x = self.transformer_encoder(x) # [NUM_POKEMON, BATCH, NUM_HIDDEN]
        x = x.permute(1,0,2) # [BATCH, NUM_POKEMON, NUM_FEATUERS]
        # print(x.shape)
        f_x = torch.mean(x[:,:6,], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS]
        s_x = torch.mean(x[:,6:,], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS]
        x = torch.cat([f_x, s_x], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS*2]
        # print(x.shape)
        x = self.head(x)  # [BATCH, NUM_CLASSES]

        return x
source.b2d410c0:
from rezero.transformer import RZTXEncoderLayer

class RezeroTransformer(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self,
                 num_features: int = 36,
                 num_hidden: int = 128,
                 dim_feedforward: int = 2048,
                 num_layers: int = 6,
                 num_heads: int = 8,
                 activation: str = 'relu',
                 drop_rate: float = 0.1,
                 num_classes: int = 1):
        super(RezeroTransformer, self).__init__()

        self.seq_linear = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_features, num_hidden),
            nn.LayerNorm(num_hidden),
            nn.Dropout(drop_rate),
            nn.ReLU(),
        )
        encoder_layer = RZTXEncoderLayer(d_model=num_hidden, nhead=num_heads, dim_feedforward=dim_feedforward, dropout=drop_rate, activation=activation)
        self.transformer_encoder = nn.TransformerEncoder(encoder_layer, num_layers)
        self.head = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_hidden*2, num_hidden),
            nn.LayerNorm(num_hidden),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(drop_rate),
            nn.Linear(num_hidden, num_classes),
        )

    def forward(self, x):
        x = self.seq_linear(x)
        x = x.permute(1,0,2) # [NUM_POKEMON, BATCH, NUM_HIDDEN]
        x = self.transformer_encoder(x) # [NUM_POKEMON, BATCH, NUM_HIDDEN]
        x = x.permute(1,0,2) # [BATCH, NUM_POKEMON, NUM_FEATUERS]
        f_x = torch.mean(x[:,:6,], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS]
        s_x = torch.mean(x[:,6:,], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS]
        x = torch.cat([f_x, s_x], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS*2]
        x = self.head(x)  # [BATCH, NUM_CLASSES]

        return x
source.3605a639:
class SkipTransformer(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self,
                 num_features: int = 36,
                 num_hidden: int = 128,
                 dim_feedforward: int = 2048,
                 num_layers: int = 6,
                 num_heads: int = 8,
                 activation: str = 'relu',
                 drop_rate: float = 0.1,
                 num_classes: int = 1,
                 alpha: float = 0.3):
        super(SkipTransformer, self).__init__()

        self.seq_linear = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_features, num_hidden),
            nn.LayerNorm(num_hidden),
            nn.Dropout(drop_rate),
            nn.ReLU(),
        )
        self.transformer_encoder_layers = [nn.TransformerEncoderLayer(d_model=num_hidden, nhead=num_heads,
                                                                      dim_feedforward=dim_feedforward,
                                                                      dropout=drop_rate, activation=activation) for i in range(num_layers)]
        self.head = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(num_hidden*2, num_hidden),
            nn.LayerNorm(num_hidden),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(drop_rate),
            nn.Linear(num_hidden, num_classes),
        )
        self.alpha = alpha

    def forward(self, x):
        x = self.seq_linear(x)
        x = x.permute(1,0,2) # [NUM_POKEMON, BATCH, NUM_HIDDEN]
        for layer in self.transformer_encoder_layers:
            x_old = x
            x = layer(x) # [NUM_POKEMON, BATCH, NUM_HIDDEN]
            x = self.alpha*x + (1-self.alpha)*x_old
        x = x.permute(1,0,2) # [BATCH, NUM_POKEMON, NUM_FEATUERS]
        f_x = torch.mean(x[:,:6,], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS]
        s_x = torch.mean(x[:,6:,], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS]
        x = torch.cat([f_x, s_x], axis=1) # [BATCH, NUM_FEATUERS*2]
        x = self.head(x)  # [BATCH, NUM_CLASSES]

        return x

source.23779595:
FilePath = tp.Union[str, Path]
Label = tp.Union[int, float, np.ndarray]


class PokemonDataset(torch.utils.data.Dataset):
    """
    Dataset using 6 channels by stacking them along time-axis

    Attributes
    ----------
    paths : tp.Sequence[FilePath]
        Sequence of path to cadence snippet file
    labels : tp.Sequence[Label]
        Sequence of label for cadence snippet file
    transform: albumentations.Compose
        composed data augmentations for data
    """

    def __init__(
        self,
        paths: tp.Sequence[FilePath],
        labels: tp.Sequence[Label],
        transform,
    ):
        """Initialize"""
        self.paths = paths
        self.labels = labels
        self.transform = transform

    def __len__(self):
        """Return num of cadence snippets"""
        return len(self.paths)

    def __getitem__(self, index: int):
        """Return transformed image and label for given index."""
        # teams, label = self.paths[index], self.labels[index]
        
        # feat = np.concatenate([get_feat(teams[0],teams[1], True),
        #                       get_feat(teams[1],teams[0], False)], axis=0)
        # feat = feat.astype(np.float32)
        feat, label = self.paths[index], self.labels[index]
        feat = feat.astype(np.float32)
        return {"features": feat, "target": label}

    def lazy_init(self, paths=None, labels=None, transform=None):
        """Reset Members"""
        if paths is not None:
            self.paths = paths
        if labels is not None:
            self.labels = labels
        if transform is not None:
            self.transform = transform

CONFIG_TYPES = {
    # # utils
    "__len__": lambda obj: len(obj),
    "method_call": lambda obj, method: getattr(obj, method)(),

    # # Dataset, DataLoader
    "PokemonDataset": PokemonDataset,
    "DataLoader": torch.utils.data.DataLoader,

    # # Model
    "SimpleTransformer": SimpleTransformer,
    "RezeroTransformer": RezeroTransformer,

    # # Optimizer
    "AdamW": optim.AdamW,

    # # Scheduler
    "OneCycleLR": lr_scheduler.OneCycleLR,

    # # Loss,Metric
    "MSELoss": nn.MSELoss,
    "RMSE": RMSE,
    "BCEWithLogitsLoss": nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss,
    "ROCAUC": ROCAUC,

    # # Metric Wrapper
    "micro_average": micro_average,
    "calc_across_all_batchs": calc_across_all_batchs,

    # # PPE Extensions
    "ExtensionsManager": ppe.training.ExtensionsManager,

    "observe_lr": ppe_exts.observe_lr,
    "LogReport": ppe_exts.LogReport,
    "PlotReport": ppe_exts.PlotReport,
    "PrintReport": ppe_exts.PrintReport,
    "PrintReportNotebook": ppe_exts.PrintReportNotebook,
    "ProgressBar": ppe_exts.ProgressBar,
    "ProgressBarNotebook": ppe_exts.ProgressBarNotebook,
    "snapshot": ppe_exts.snapshot,
    "LRScheduler": ppe_exts.LRScheduler, 
    "SendWandB":SendWandB,

    "MinValueTrigger": ppe_triggers.MinValueTrigger,
    "MaxValueTrigger": ppe_triggers.MaxValueTrigger,
    "EarlyStoppingTrigger": ppe_triggers.EarlyStoppingTrigger,
}
source.b9e70071:
def train_one_fold(cfg, train_all):
    """Main"""
    torch.backends.cudnn.benchmark = True
    set_random_seed(cfg["/globals/seed"], deterministic=True)
    device = torch.device(cfg["/globals/device"])
    
    train_path_label, val_path_label = get_path_label(cfg, train_all)
    print("train: {}, val: {}".format(len(train_path_label["paths"]), len(val_path_label["paths"])))
   
    cfg["/dataset/train"].lazy_init(**train_path_label)
    cfg["/dataset/val"].lazy_init(**val_path_label)
    train_loader = cfg["/loader/train"]
    val_loader = cfg["/loader/val"]

    model = cfg["/model"]
    model.to(device)
    optimizer = cfg["/optimizer"]
    loss_func = cfg["/loss"]
    loss_func.to(device)
    
    manager = cfg["/manager"]
    for ext in cfg["/extensions"]:
        if isinstance(ext, dict):
            manager.extend(**ext)
        else:
            manager.extend(ext)

    evaluator = ppe_exts.Evaluator(
        val_loader, model, eval_func=get_eval_func(cfg, model, device),
        metrics=cfg["/eval"], progress_bar=False)
    manager.extend(evaluator, trigger=(1, "epoch"))

    use_amp = cfg["/globals/enable_amp"]
    scaler = amp.GradScaler(enabled=use_amp)
    use_mixup = cfg["/dataset/mixup/enabled"]
    mixup_alpha = cfg["/dataset/mixup/alpha"]
    
    while not manager.stop_trigger:
        model.train()
        for batch in train_loader:
            with manager.run_iteration():
                batch = to_device(batch, device)
                x, t = batch["features"], batch["target"]
                # # for mixup
                mixed_x, t_a, t_b, lam = mixup_data(use_mixup, x, t, mixup_alpha)
                criterion = get_criterion(use_mixup, loss_func)
                
                optimizer.zero_grad()
                with amp.autocast(use_amp):
                    y = model(mixed_x)
                    loss = criterion(y, t_a, t_b, lam)
                scaler.scale(loss).backward()
                scaler.step(optimizer)
                scaler.update()
                
                ppe.reporting.report({'train/loss': loss.item()})

best_log_list = []
for pre_eval_cfg, fold_id in zip(pre_eval_cfg_list, FOLDS):
    exp_dir_path = TMP / f"fold{fold_id}"
    log = pd.read_json(exp_dir_path / "log")
    best_log = log.iloc[[log["val/metric"].idxmax()],]
    best_epoch = best_log.epoch.values[0]
    best_log_list.append(best_log)
    
    # best_model_path = exp_dir_path / f"snapshot_by_metric_epoch_{best_epoch}.pth"
    best_model_path = exp_dir_path / f"snapshot_by_metric.pth"
    copy_to = f"{OUTPUT}/best_metric_model_fold{fold_id}.pth"
    shutil.copy(best_model_path, copy_to)
    
    for p in exp_dir_path.glob("*.pth"):
        p.unlink()
    
    shutil.copytree(exp_dir_path, f"{OUTPUT}/fold{fold_id}")
    
    with open(f"{OUTPUT}/fold{fold_id}/config.yml", "w") as fw:
        yaml.dump(pre_eval_cfg, fw)
    
pd.concat(best_log_list, axis=0, ignore_index=True)
source.fa232566:
def run_inference_loop(cfg, model, loader, device):
    model.to(device)
    model.eval()
    pred_list = []
    with torch.no_grad():
        for batch in tqdm(loader):
            x = to_device(batch["features"], device)
            y = model(x)
            # pred_list.append(y.detach().cpu().numpy())
            pred_list.append(y.sigmoid().detach().cpu().numpy())
        
    pred_arr = np.concatenate(pred_list)
    del pred_list
    return pred_arr
source.d479920f:
label_arr = train[CLASSES].values
oof_pred_arr = np.zeros((len(train), N_CLASSES))
score_list = []
test_pred_arr = np.zeros((N_FOLDS, len(smpl_sub), N_CLASSES))
test_path_label = {
    "paths": battle_feat_test,
    "labels": smpl_sub[CLASSES].values.astype("f")
}

for fold_id in range(N_FOLDS):
    print(f"[fold {fold_id}]")
    tmp_dir = Path(f"{OUTPUT}/fold{fold_id}")
    with open(tmp_dir / "config.yml", "r") as fr:
        cfg = Config(yaml.safe_load(fr), types=CONFIG_TYPES)
    device = torch.device(cfg["/globals/device"])
    val_idx = train.query("fold == @fold_id").index.values

    # # get_dataloader
    _, val_path_label = get_path_label(cfg, train)
    cfg["/dataset/val"].lazy_init(**val_path_label)
    cfg["/dataset/test"].lazy_init(**test_path_label)
    val_loader = cfg["/loader/val"]
    test_loader = cfg["/loader/test"]
    
    # # get model
    model_path = f"{OUTPUT}/best_metric_model_fold{fold_id}.pth"
    model = cfg["/model"]
    model.load_state_dict(torch.load(model_path, map_location=device))
    
    # # inference
    val_pred = run_inference_loop(cfg, model, val_loader, device)
    val_score = roc_auc_score(label_arr[val_idx], val_pred)
    oof_pred_arr[val_idx] = val_pred
    score_list.append([fold_id, val_score])
    
    test_pred_arr[fold_id] = run_inference_loop(cfg, model, test_loader, device)
    
    del cfg, val_idx, val_path_label
    del model, val_loader, test_loader
    torch.cuda.empty_cache()
    gc.collect()
    
    print(f"val score: {val_score:.4f}")

source.d9a48b2e:
## config_types for evaluating configuration

I use [pytorch-pfn-extras](https://github.com/pfnet/pytorch-pfn-extras) for training NNs. This library has useful config systems but requires some preparation.

For more details, see [docs](https://github.com/pfnet/pytorch-pfn-extras/blob/master/docs/config.md).
